meanings.definition: In a state of disorder or confusion.
meanings.sent1: The room became messier as the children played.
meanings.sent2: Her desk was getting messier with each passing day.
meanings.sent3: The party turned messier when the cake accidentally fell on the floor.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts grew messier as the deadline approached.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle looked even messier after the cat knocked some pieces off the table.

meanings.sent1: Please don't messier the kitchen after I just cleaned it.
meanings.sent2: The kids always manage to messier their clothes while playing outside.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally messiered my shirt with paint during the art class.
meanings.sent4: The rain started to messier the freshly washed car.
meanings.sent5: He tends to messier the living room whenever he has friends over.

meanings.sent1: The author of the book is named John Messier.
meanings.sent2: Messier is a common last name in some French-speaking regions.
meanings.sent3: Mr. Messier's signature is always so elegant.
meanings.sent4: The Messier family has been living in this town for generations.
meanings.sent5: I wonder if there's any relation between Marie Messier and the famous painter.
